note.p: Chair maker, poultry dealer, and bird cage maker. Of 28 Club Row, Bethnal Green, London, 1861–95. Son of Barnet Latliff (or Latlieff), sugar baker, brewer, and his wife Mary Judith Bardeaux, who married in Spitalfields in 1810. Married Ann Long (1812/13–39) in 1835; Ruth Medland (1820–62) in 1860, and Mary Elizabeth Griffin Mayo (1809/10–83; daughter of John Arnoll, artist, and widow of Joseph Richard Mayo, whom she married in 1833) in 1864. Father of John Latliff (1836–1913), poultry dealer, of 75 Sclater Street.
